metadata.subject: BROCKMAN, INC. AUCTIONS NOISE BY DANIEL KAHNEMAN, OLIVIER SIBONY, AND CASS R. SUNSTEIN 30 MARKETS

organizations: White House Office of Information and Regulatory Affairs
President Obama's Review Group on Intelligence and Communication Technologies
locations: 260 Fifth Avenue, New York, New York 10001

relationships.description: Represented by Brockman, Inc. for book rights

analysis.purpose: To announce the successful auction of book rights for 'NOISE' and promote the authors and their accomplishments
analysis.significance: Documents a major publishing deal involving three prominent academics and sets new records for publishing advances

notable_quotes: "We've never seen a week like this in the 45-year history of Brockman, Inc. Thirty auctions were conducted within a week, all setting new agency records for publishing advances in each market"
"Daniel Kahneman, Olivier Sibony, and Cass Sunstein are three of the greatest thinkers of our time, and I believe NOISE will be one of our most influential books, with far-reaching applications"

blackmail_indicators.description: No indicators of blackmail or coercion found in this press release

illegal_activity.description: No illegal activity mentioned or discussed

details: References to The New York Times Bestseller List
Mention of The New York Times Book Review coverage

public_knowledge.context: This appears to be a public press release about a major publishing deal involving prominent academics and authors

analysis.summary: Brockman, Inc. announced the successful auction of book rights for 'NOISE' by Daniel Kahneman, Olivier Sibony, and Cass R. Sunstein, setting new records for publishing advances across 30 markets. The press release highlights the authors' prestigious backgrounds and the significant commercial success of Kahneman's previous book 'Thinking Fast and Slow'.
